titleStmt.title: Motives maintained. Or a reply vnto M. Chillingvvorthes ansvvere to his ovvne motiues of his conuersion to Catholike religion
titleStmt.author: Knott, Edward, 1582-1656.

notesStmt.note: By Edward Knott, a pseudonym used by Matthew Wilson from 1692 onwards.
Printer and place of publication from STC.

An answer to: "The religion of Protestants a safe way to salvation", by William Chillingworth, which was a reply to "Mercy and truth; or, charity maintained by Catholiques", written by Wilson under the pseudonym Edward Knott.
Reproduction of the original in Yale University. Library.
